item.title: Glīd won Startup Battlefield 2025 by building solutions to make logistics simpler, safer, and smarter
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen, Maggie Nye
item.description: We're excited to interview the winner of Startup Battlefield 2025, and Glid co-founder Kevin Damoa, on this week's Build Mode!

item.title: From military logistics to Startup Battlefield 2025 champion with Glīd founder, Kevin Damoa
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: Glīd CEO and founder Kevin Damoa shares what it takes to win Startup Battlefield 2025 and build a company solving real infrastructure problems. Fresh off his victory, De reveals how a veteran’s perspective on logistics led to an autonomous solution bridging congested roads and underutilized rail. Plus, he shares how mindfulness, mission-driven culture, and $70M in early customer commitments positioned Glīd for success. New episodes of Build […]

item.title: Nordic founders are taking bigger swings, and it’s paying off
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: Ten years ago, raising €1 million in Copenhagen was enough to make waves in the region’s tech scene. Today, the Nordics are turning out billion-dollar companies like Lovable — which hit $200 million in revenue just 12 months after launching. Dennis Green-Lieber, founder of AI-powered customer intelligence platform Propane, has had a front-row seat to that shift […]

item.title: Here are the 49 US AI startups that have raised $100M or more in 2025
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Last year was monumental for the AI industry in the U.S. and beyond. How will 2025 compare?

item.title: JustiGuide wants to use AI to help people navigate the US immigration system
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: The startup uses AI to help immigrants understand the system, connect with lawyers, and reduce associated costs.

item.title: A comprehensive list of 2025 tech layoffs
item.dc:creator: Cody Corrall, Alyssa Stringer, Kate Park
item.description: A complete list of all the known layoffs in tech, from Big Tech to startups, broken down by month throughout 2024.

item.title: Breaking down the boom in the Nordic’s startup ecosystem
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: On this week’s Equity, we sat down with Dennis Green-Lieber, the founder of the AI company Propane, to talk about the booming success of the Nordic ecosystem.

item.title: The Nordic startup scene has quietly become one of tech’s fastest-growing hubs
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo, Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Ten years ago, raising €1 million in Copenhagen was enough to make waves in the region’s tech scene. Today, the Nordics are turning out billion-dollar companies like Lovable — which hit $200 million in revenue just 12 months after launching. Dennis Green-Lieber, founder of AI-powered customer intelligence platform Propane, has had a front-row seat to that shift […]

item.title: Are you balding? There’s an AI for that
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: MyHair AI examines photos of the scalp to help diagnose hair loss and suggest scientifically validated clinics and treatments.

item.title: Why ‘hold forever’ investors are snapping up venture capital ‘zombies’
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: An investor explains the "buy, fix, and hold" model employed by Bending Spoons and similar companies that buy distressed startups.

item.title: Find Your Grind raises $5M to grow platform empowering students to explore unique career paths
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Nick Gross says that Find Your Grind gives students the tools to explore what careers are out there and what paths suit their strengths, interests, and visions for what they want their futures to look like.

item.title: How Glīd won Startup Battlefield 2025: Mentorship, mission-focus, and meditation
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen, Maggie Nye
item.description: This week in Build Mode, Startup Battlefield editor Isabelle Johannessen is joined by the winner of this year’s competition, Kevin Damoa, the CEO and founder of Glīd, a logistics infrastructure company that aims to streamline the complex container shipment process.

item.title: Fleet Space finds massive lithium deposit using AI and satellites
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The discovery suggests that a region in Quebec might hold even more lithium than originally suspected.

item.title: Google teams up with Accel to hunt for India’s next AI breakouts
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Google and Accel will jointly invest up to $2 million in each startup through their new partnership.

item.title: Hands on with Stickerbox, the AI-powered sticker maker for kids
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Stickerbox turns kids’ ideas into printable stickers, blending AI magic with hands-on coloring for a surprisingly creative, "screen-light" play experience.

item.title: X-energy rides nuclear wave, raises $700M Series D
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The small modular reactor startup is capitalizing on surging interest from tech companies and data center developers.

item.title: Former MrBeast content strategist is building an AI tool for creator ideation and analytics
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Palo is a tool for short-video creators to gain insights into what is working for them.

item.title: Beehiiv’s CEO isn’t worried about newsletter saturation
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Beehiiv's co-founder and CEO Tyler Denk spoke to TechCrunch about why the company has been expanding, and where the media business is going next.

item.title: Byju’s founder to appeal US court order to pay over $1B in bankruptcy case
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: A U.S. bankruptcy court has ordered Byju's founder Byju Raveendran to pay over $1.07 billion in a case over missing company funds.

item.title: Bret Taylor’s Sierra reaches $100M ARR in under two years
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The startup’s rapid growth suggests that enerprises are embracing AI agents.
